title: Meanwhile in Top Lane?
body:
As a person that mostly plays tanks and bruisers (mele champs in general) i noticed there are so many viable ranged champions that can be played top
Gnar,Kennen,Vladimir,Swain and so many more. Maybe not all of them are OP but they are extremely hard to deal with as a mele champ.

Imagine Darius against one of those , or for example against Kayle (now gets ranged AA at lv 6 ). She beats u early bcs of the range and in late game she becomes a monster and beats ur entire team.

Only thing u can actually do is giving up on farm and hopeing ur jg will gank cuz if not ur lane is ruined 

Any other strategy?

EDIT: Ik there are champs like renekton that have a good engage against ranged champs but lets not forget u might get first or second pick in champ select so u dont know if the enemy top will be ranged

replies.body:
The way ranged vs melee matchups go:

Passively ranged will win trades and bully you out of lane.

If you can all-in them early on. (Before they get too mobile and have infinite poke) and force them out of lane, there is nothing they can do.
Issue is most of the picks that are ranged have tool(s) to save them from all ins.

Yup.

Examples:

{{champion:67}} : Point and Click Knockback that also acts as a Proc for her W and can stun if the target hits a wall. Invis through her Tumble while Ulted.

{{champion:133}} : Skillshot Blind that, if it connects, she can use to escape while your vision is reduced. Also has her Vault knockback.

{{champion:13}} : Slow that he can turn into a conditional root. Also Ult that literally teleports him away from you.

{{champion:8}} : Literal Get-Out-Of-Jail-Free card W.

{{champion:51}} (I admit I don't see her as much as the above 4): Spamable traps that Root. Self-Knockback that applies a slow if it connects.

{{champion:518}} : Root that gets EMPOWERED when going through minions. Invis that sends a Decoy in the chosen direction.

{{champion:18}} (I see her even less than Cait, but it's not impossible to see her either) : Literally Jump that can't be stopped once started. Knockback Ult.

I'm sure there are more, but that's all I can think of.

And all those champs suck dick in top lane. well neeko and kennen are ok.

how about you give examples of good tops o wait you can't.

kennen, neeko, swain, vlad, gnar, teemo, karma, quinn, ryze and vayne. 

urgot could technically be on the list but he is practically a melee with his minimal mobility and self slow
None of them are good.

> [{quoted}](name=boricCentaur1,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RhydlJIV,comment-id=000000020001000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-31T02:36:45.278+0000)
>
> None of them are good.

kennen: 50.46% winrate. he apparently isnt good, by your standards. 
neeko: 51.49% winrate. so bad.
swain: 49.31%
gnar: 49.32%
teemo: 50.16%
karma: 49.18%
quinn: 52.12%. terrible.
ryze: 49.34%

theyre all so bad, it hurts my eyes to just look at them.

WInrate means nothing. Stop using stats if you don't understand what they show. THEY ALL HAVE SHIT STATS NO PICK RATE,NO BAN RATE means they suck. 

Talk about not understanding your own stats, cool all you showed why when carry champs have a low play rate they have high win rate and that is how it works.

IF THOSE CHAMPS WERE STRONG PEOPLE WOULD PLAY THEM!!!!!!!!!

Real intelligent

"Just Because no one plays them they suck"

just think over that sentence
pick rate is based off of **Popularity**. If a champ is stupid broken, then of course they will be more popular, but just because they are not popular doesn't mean they are not good.

I main Pre-rework Mordekaiser for almost 6 months, and had close to a 60% winrate. And yet no one picked him so he must not be good based on your logic.

I don't think anyone would say pre rework mord was good, so yeah he sucked. 

But also with few exceptions they have a another role with higher playrates meaning they are not good in top lane.

If it's only mains and a few others that means they're not good.

Like ranges are bad plain and simple.

I'm sorry, where in my comment above do I say whether the champs I listed were good or bad when played in Top Lane?

I was merely expanding on what Ragnaveil said regarding many of the ranged champs that DO go Top often have tools or forms of disengage that prevent them, when used wisely anyways, from being all-inned by a Melee Champ. I then proceeded to give examples of said tools, based on the Ranged Champions that I (As a Juggernaut and Tank player in the Top Lane) have faced in the past.

Gnar is probably the least oppressive one of them all and I consider him to be in a good spot as a healthy ranged top laner:

- He has a long ranged skillshot that's on a moderate cooldown and deals moderate damage and is also stopped by minions.
- His basic attack range is really low at the start for a ranged champion (425)
- His escape ability is on a massive cooldown early (22s)
- He has downtime on his ranged harass due to his rage mechanic
- He has no CC outside of MegaGnar

Meanwhile you have stupid shit like Kennen:

- Has a moderate ranged skillshot on a moderate CD as well... only he has no reason to use it outside point blank when you engage because...
- His basic attack range is stupidly long (550)
- His escape ability is on such an outrageously low cooldown (10s) and his CC is always readily available that they use their E for the AS buff when poking
- 0 downtime on his harass due to being manaless and not gated in any other form (what energy costs?)
- Has CC readily available at every second to fight off all-ins via EW -> Q or auto

Gnar is the absolute worst of them all and the most unhealthy champion to ever grace toplane. 

You can't all in him, you can't poke him you can't go for short trades you can't go for long trades and after an item he just autoattacks you to death in melee range. Gnar is the absolute worst abomination, ever. 

Btw "massive" cooldown meanwhile renek has 18 seconds on his dash. Camille has 16 seconds. 20 seconds on hecarim. 14 seconds on kled jousting. So it's not like melees have a lot of opportunity to get onto him. 


Kennen is due for nerfs for a long time now yeah. Kennen and gnar are both up there as the worst designs ever. Not functional unless they read "beats every melee champion forever and ever".

Yes, 22 seconds is massive. That's a respectable cooldown for a ranged champion's escape tool. Also he doesn't max this first.

Meanwhile Camille is maxing E first AND has Q MS and W slow to scare Gnar into using his E earlier (plus her E is lower cooldown from the get-go by 6 seconds). Hecarim is a jungler that's been essentially banned from top lane outside counterpicks. Kled can actually just run Gnar down easily with how ridiculously long ranged his recast E is combined with his Q pull (not to mentioning ult) plus his E cd is much shorter (6 seconds). So it's like melees have a lot of opportunity to get onto him.

If Gnar is giving you trouble then you're facing some damn good Gnars that might just be better than you. Meanwhile I'm over here bopping every Gnar I see as Yorick (an immobile melee champion, his premier target) in GM.

Like what do you want from him? A 60s cd on his E? I'm all on board the fuck oppressive ranged top laners train but Gnar is not on the list right now.
you dont just scare gnar into using his mobility. you jump on gnar and he starts autoing you to death in melee.

Lol i'd love to fight gnar in melee range as darius, even mega gnar (as long as I'm not too close). Who I don't like fighting in any range is aatrox however lol. Btw, when did aatrox get the free ghost on his ult? I realized recently that I can neither chase nor escape him when his ult is up, even when I have flash AND ghost, which is honestly broken af, since it's near impossible to duel the dude as well and he just spams refreshable Q for major AOE damage, CC, and healing. I can honestly say that I'm super glad he'll be receiving the MS nerf to his ult soon, which MIGHT be enough to make it fair...but honestly I don't know. I preferred when he had a revive over this shit where he gets a million Q resets and a million MS boost.

> [{quoted}](name=ImTheJuggernauty,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RhydlJIV,comment-id=0000000200000000000000010000,timestamp=2019-08-30T16:28:33.854+0000)
>
> Lol i'd love to fight gnar in melee range as darius, even mega gnar (as long as I'm not too close). Who I don't like fighting in any range is aatrox however lol. Btw, when did aatrox get the free ghost on his ult? I realized recently that I can neither chase nor escape him when his ult is up, even when I have flash AND ghost, which is honestly broken af, since it's near impossible to duel the dude as well and he just spams refreshable Q for major AOE damage, CC, and healing. I can honestly say that I'm super glad he'll be receiving the MS nerf to his ult soon, which MIGHT be enough to make it fair...but honestly I don't know. I preferred when he had a revive over this shit where he gets a million Q resets and a million MS boost.

he gets no q "resets". the "million" ms boost is 30%-100% based on rank for a rather short duration which he spends in his q animation most of the time anyway. btw, when did this become an aatrox discussion? we could also talk about how cancerous darius is to fight in melee range if you wish so

To be fair, I don't think gnar is broken, I just think he is worse to deal with as an immobile low range melee than kennen. Like, Yorick at least has a wall and that E thing at pretty good range, plus if you hit your E, all your ghouls jump to the target, so he is much better at fighting ranged champs than darius, especially if you have your R up. 

The thing with kennen is, once darius gets the teensiest amount of armor, plus spectre's cowl, he can usually catch and out trade kennen if he gets a little too frisky, and at the least, outlast his poke and all-ins.

> [{quoted}](name=Cind3rkick,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RhydlJIV,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-29T21:15:05.796+0000)
>
> The way ranged vs melee matchups go:
> 
> Passively ranged will win trades and bully you out of lane.
> 
> If you can all-in them early on. (Before they get too mobile and have infinite poke) and force them out of lane, there is nothing they can do.

{{champion:106}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:240}} {{champion:2}}  can all trade pretty well early game vs ranged.

> [{quoted}](name=BennieBoi,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RhydlJIV,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2019-08-29T22:16:47.171+0000)
>
> {{champion:106}} {{champion:266}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:240}} {{champion:2}}  can all trade pretty well early game vs ranged.

voli cant do a damn thing to rangeds early. he can just... run at them and get hit by skillshots for free and, even if he does flip them, he eats minion aggro damage.

jax loses trades vs rangeds before triforce
jax, aatrox, and irelia are honestly good against 95% of toplane matchups. The exceptions are each other and maybe riven lol.

I mean almost every lane has some kind of cancer to deal with, but Top is by far the worst one, I've gotta admit.

I hear Toplaner scream for help about this for like 1 year now and Riot seems to give 0 fucks, at least that's what I'm seeing.

But again, maybe I missed smth, so don't take my word for that lol.

Honestly, the problem isn't only the counters, it's the gankability of top, especially with champs such as twitch, kayn, ev, shaco, rammus, etc. If you aren't a safe champ with easy escapes, you can't afford to go past 1/3 of your lane with any sense of safety since wards are nearly useless these days anyway unless you have like 4 of them sitting out there in absurd places. Like, twitch should in no way be able to gank before level 4 or 5 and be able to do actual damage...EVER. I don't mind twitch adc, but twitch jg is such bullshit by default

another problem is that ranged champs are generally better early (some exceptions, Skill,Counters,and situation) but usually if you play safe and farm under turret or go make impacts somewhere else in map then you  can easily beat them. Most of toplane meta right now is counterpick (which riot does need to change and balance) but if you can outplay an opponent it should generally be easy to win lane. All about game knowledge and how you take your battles

> or for example against Kayle

until level 6 Kayle should not be able to touch a single minion without using Q and E if you're Darius, you literally burn her flash every time you grab her with E.
After that you just have to play around your pull, and wait for her to ult, she cant duel you 1v1 after you pull her, her only option is to escape as fast as possible.

The problem is that doesn't really mean you win against her. Once she hits lvl 3, it's near impossible to really get ahold of kayle and finish her (providing that either both of you have flash or neither of you) since she has both a speed boost, a heal, and a range aoe slow that's easy to hit on darius, plus a range massive scaling execute (almost as good as some ultimates as far as executes go). If she merely farms half the CS that darius gets, and knows how and where to freeze lane, she will outscale by default and simply because more useful. If darius doesn't put her down by 3 or more kills then he lost the matchup. One kill (barring jg influence on either side) is virtually guaranteed for darius, but other than that, a good kayle can play ultra safe and get decent CS

You have a pull, and a slow aswell, your pull nullifies her slow because you get her in melee range, your W nullifies her MS because it slows her as soon as you pull.
Your Q when she eventually runs, does extra damage and heals you.
In no way can Kayle trade with Darius pre-level 6, after 6 it's more of a skill match ups of cat and mouse on how well Kayle can stay out of Darius's reach.

But that's my point. At no point does kayle HAVE to fight darius melee range unless he uses flash and ghost (but hey she has flash too). And even then, if she plays it safe, freezes lane near tower whenever she gets the chance, snags cs from range with abilities when she's not near tower, and just doesn't fight darius, he won't get fed enough. Since she massively outscales him, all she has to do is not give up a three kill lead to darius and/or a 60 cs lead. If she manages that, she won lane. 

Aside from ghost and flash, she never HAS to be in range of his pull. If he can't pull her, she'll never even be close enough for him to W. OF course though, some kayles are dweebs and play frisky (myself included when I try kayle from time to time) and get too close too early only to be slaughtered. But otherwise, I've played against some real good ones too, and they are NEAR impossible all in AND finish off before they escape and heal. They simply poke when it's convenient, farm, escape, wash rinse repeat. If they poke successfully for long enough, I'm the one who has to back so they don't execute me with E. Against a good kayle, I can maybe force one kill on her during lane, possibly two (all of this assuming neutral jg influence). Simply put, that's not enough to bury her or get ahead

She needs to CS, putting yourself between her and the CS not only deleys her items (due to lost gold) but also from experience, Kayle is a time bomb, eventually she'll beat anyone, your job in lane is to deley it as much as you can, not just by killing her, but denying her every resource you can.
Turret plates, minion gold, kill gold, Experience etc...
After she hits level 6, you probably have phage, gives a nice MS to try to get a good pull while she stops to CS, her range is 525, Darius's pull is 545-560 (something a BIT longer range than her AA range), a good Darius will know when to go in when she starts her auto attack animation, proc his phage, and go in for pull.

Also, burning ghost is not a bad idea, it has a pretty low CD and it almost gurantees you'll be in melee range for the next duration.

I'm not saying it's fun playing against her, or that it's conventional, but it's not impossible or even that hard until she hits her powerpsike, then it becomes a TEAM effort.

I agree with most of what you say sort of...but I don't agree with you method of dealing with Kayle. True she needs CS, but you can't simply body block the minions. She can easily chunk darius down with her abilities until he has to retreat in about 3-5 poke rotations (and with corrupting potion, she can easily outlast). On top that, her range aoe slow is both hard for darius to dodge, and makes it VERY difficult to reach her, on top of her own speed boost, even with ghost unless she is extended at least 3/5 of the lane

I play mostly Juggernauts (Garen/Illaoi/etc.), not exactly Tanks, but I have to deal with Melee vs Ranged match-ups all the same.

And basically, yes, you have to give up some farm. In such a match-up, your goal is not to **win** laning phase, it's to **stay even**. Because in most cases, these ranged picks Top are a bet to win the game early, and **time is playing for you**. Picking a ranged Top laner usually means that the overall team-comp lacks either utility or durability, and your team will have a better shot at winning full 5v5 team-fights.

So the strategy is (trying to) staying even, most of all not dying, and playing for late game.

Also, in *some* match-ups, you have a power-spike around level 6-10 when you finally get enough damage to kill your opponent in one rotation and you can all-in them. But this you have to learn on a case-by-case basis, there is no general rule. For instance, Garen vs Teemo is around level 7-8, whereas Garen vs Vlad is after one full MR item+one damage component (Phage or Sheen), and so around level 10.
Just remember the possibility might be there and try and look for it.
Wise words
That’s why melee champions get kits that auto win once in melee with a ranged champion.
or at least they should
Take exhaust and flash or play renekton . Point being is you need engages. I play Olaf shen or voli
What if i get first pick and i want to go illaoi , darius or something with low mobility?

Maybe they need to adjust it so that top laners just CAN'T be first pick....lol because it truly is ridiculous. Not even mages get countered as hard by assassins, as they can at least play back a ways and farm why building mana and zhonyas and they have shorter lanes so they don't have to extend so far.

Eh.
I play mostly Darius recently (am an OG Gangplank Onetrick) and with Ghost you can punish mistakes way earlier, without having to rush Mobility Items to catch up.

While I do agree that Ranged Top (with no mana costs) are cancer, I usually tend to win lane/Game against them.
But then a random Kennen/Vlad appears and I want to off myself. :)
Well 99% of the community who play ranged are really bad at it and will let you get into melee non stop. Ofc it is winnable from there.

Kennen doesn't seem to do a great deal of damage anymore for some reason. Darius can punish him a lot more easily because of that.

That said, Vlad top is still cancer because he will never let you do a damn thing to him.

Um.

Kayle used to beat Darius's ass with melee lvl 6 before mini-rework.
No she didn't. Not even close. Kayle after her full-scale rework had one of the worst early games out there.

> [{quoted}](name=BlackKnightJack,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RhydlJIV,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2019-08-30T00:45:42.862+0000)
>

By deleting Darius by engaging with passive exalted waves killing him in her full combo before ue could stack 5 bleed stacks?

Sure thing pal.

> [{quoted}](name=Vlada Cut,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=RhydlJIV,comment-id=000b00000000,timestamp=2019-08-30T20:15:05.765+0000)

You mean the things she doesn't have during the laning phase?
In what way does kayle beat Darius? In early Darius should win and should prevent kayle from farming. If you failed to those then of course you would lose to a kayle.
because she can play uber safe with her abilities and farm up at range (even if she gets only half cs, she wins the lane as long as she doesn't give up a net kill deficit of 3 or more to darius)
As a jayce main smurf, git gud.
Jayce is q ranged bully too>.>

Yup. And yet ive never lost to a jayce laner or ranged laner except teemo because i know how to counter them lol. If you want to know how to play against ranged matchups just play ranged and see what their weaknesses are

I didn't say *i* didn't know how to.. i have beaten jayces before. I'm just pointing out jayce is an easy overtuned champion that is ranged he is complaining about and you aren't good. Don't say git gud when you play things like jayce.
